image.altText: man in a suit next to a woman in red jacket and a younger man in a black shirt casting their vote

props.synopsis: The voting has closed, the counting begins on the Australian federal election. Follow live.

title.children: First polls close, counting begins in eastern states

image.altText: Liberal Party leader Peter Dutton speaks passionately behind a podium with a sign reading "Get Australia back on track".

props.synopsis: Election campaigns are often quite stage managed but the number of twists in the Coalition's public service policy has resembled a giant pretzel, leaving Canberra voters bewildered about what to expect for their city should the government change.

title.children: Coalition public service policy twists bewilder Canberra voters

image.altText: A person places a vote in a Senate ballot box for Canberra.

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: All the ACT seats, candidates and voting facts you need to know

image.altText: An artist's impresiion of a high-rise residential development.

props.synopsis: Two companies that made false claims about approvals for light rail stops near a luxury apartment building in Woden are fined more than $3 million each under consumer laws.

title.children: 'Scornful of consumers': Canberra companies fined millions over false advertising

image.altText: A woman with short, light hair, smiling outdoors.

props.synopsis: Queanbeyan-Palerang Regional Council is auctioning two dozen properties to recover unpaid rates. But local Gina Greentree says the council has bungled the process, with the farmer bidding for a lot she thought she owned.

title.children: Property of man dead for 65 years among lots auctioned for unpaid rates

image.altText: A man in a jacket looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Liberal candidate Jacob Vadakkedathu called the Coalition's plans to cut jobs in the public service "not realistic" and "not practical".

title.children: Liberal candidate breaks ranks with Peter Dutton over public service

image.altText: A man stands in front of a railway level crossing

props.synopsis: Federal candidate for Riverina and Wagga Wagga councillor Richard Foley labelled people in his electorate as the "dumbest f****" in a since deleted social post.

title.children: Riverina candidate labels his electorate's voters 'dumbest on this planet'

image.altText: Kendrick Lamar smiles and points as he performs in a blue and black leather jacket, blue jeans, gloves and a black backwards cap

props.synopsis: No crying over this one, mates.

title.children: Kendrick, Doechii, Dominic Fike and more tapped for Spilt Milk's big return

image.altText: Peter Mamouzelos of the Rabbitohs is attended to by trainers, carried up off the ground

props.synopsis: Already decimated by injuries, South Sydney loses fullback Jye Gray to a painful cork and hooker Peter Mamouzelos to a dislocated elbow as the Knights win 30-4 at a rain-soaked Lang Park in Magic Round. Follow live.

title.children: Souths hooker suffers ugly dislocated elbow to end horror loss to Knights

image.altText: Ben Keays gets bumped by an opponent just after kicking the ball

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs demolish Port Adelaide in a one-sided encounter in Ballarat, while Adelaide prepares to host Carlton. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Crows in control against Blues in Adelaide, Bulldogs complete demolition of Power

image.altText: Qantas logo on Sydney Airport terminal glass

props.synopsis: A Qantas customer service employee has sustained head injuries after falling off an aerobridge in Sydney Airport, around 5 metres above the ground, earlier this afternoon.

title.children: Qantas employee in hospital after falling 5 metres from aerobridge at Sydney Airport

image.altText: Liberal campaign bus stuck

props.synopsis: In the final week of the campaign, the Liberal campaign bus mounted a kerb and became stuck. It reflected a sentiment held by some within the Coalition about where the party's campaign had ended.

title.children: A single moment early in this election campaign came to define it

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a road.

props.synopsis: Brittany McDermott first saw the woman she will vote for on election day on a panel alongside politicians from the two major parties.

title.children: How everyday Australians told us they were planning to vote today

image.altText: A graphic which shows peter dutton with two women behind him

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton prepare for a sprint to the election finish line, what are the key seats to watch in Queensland?

title.children: Dutton's race for PM among key seats to watch this election

image.altText: A soldier from the Papua New Guinea Defence Force aims his long back gun at an angle.

props.synopsis: Australia could get its own version of the UK's decorated Gurkha warriors under a new security treaty expected to allow PNG citizens to join the ADF.

title.children: Does the ADF want its own version of the UK's Gurkha warriors?

image.altText: A man's hand controlling chat robots with strings attached to his fingers, with the Russian flag in the background.

props.synopsis: A pro-Russian influence operation has been targeting Australia in the lead-up to this weekend's federal election, the ABC can reveal, attempting to "poison" AI chatbots with propaganda.

title.children: Pro-Russian influence operation targeting Australia in lead-up to election

image.altText: Vanya Gaberova looks into a bathroom mirror wearing glasses capable of recording video.

props.synopsis: Operating out of a rundown hotel in Norfolk, Russian spies known as "The Minions" and their ringleader, who went by the codename "Jackie Chan", gathered information on targets of interest to Russia for years but, after being caught, they will soon be sentenced.

title.children: They were supposed to be spying for Russia, but they made a big mess

image.altText: Donald Trump smiling while speaking at a black microphone and wearing a dark suit and blue tie

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump wants to decrease governmental spending by almost 23 per cent amid a sweeping restructure of domestic priorities, but will seek approval for a boost to defence.

title.children: Five key takeaways from Trump's plan to slash the US budget

image.altText: A man with slicked back blond hair standing with his lips pursed in red prison clothing

props.synopsis: Illinois man Joseph Czuba stabbed and killed Wadee Alfayoumi and knifed his mother Hanan Shaheen days after Israel began its war on Gaza in October 2023.

title.children: US man jailed for 53 years over Islamophobic killing of six-year-old boy

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton shake hands ahead of ABC Debate.

props.synopsis: From injuring a camera operator with a wayward kick to denying falling off a stage, it has been an exhausting five weeks for the two men vying for Australia's top job.

title.children: The wild and wacky moments that shaped the federal election campaign

image.altText: A man holding a snake out in front of him.

props.synopsis: Scientists have used blood from an American man who injected himself with snake venom for years to create what they say is "the most broadly effective antivenom to date" — at least in mice.

title.children: Blood of man bitten by hundreds of snakes key to new antivenom

image.altText: Virginia Trioli Osaka photo 2 Umekita Park

props.synopsis: On a recent trip to Japan I went in search of what had been described to me as a near perfect example of an urban green development in one of the most green-starved cities in the world.

title.children: A visit to a park in Osaka made me dream big for Australia's green spaces

image.altText: A composite photo showing two women and a man, with a sheep in front of them

props.synopsis: The ABC asked every Australian politician if they wore wool on the campaign trail.

title.children: Which politicians are wearing Aussie wool as industry pleads for help?

image.altText: A redheaded man with a cropped beard walks past a brick-walled building

props.synopsis: Prince Harry has lost his challenge over police protection despite his lawyer warning his "life is at stake".

title.children: Prince Harry wants 'reconciliation' but King Charles 'won't speak' to him

image.altText: Two men trail after a house that is in the process of being moved along a hill.

props.synopsis: A wave of dam building during the mid-20th century displaced dozens of towns, villages and First Nations communities. A public history project hopes to recover them.

title.children: These towns were drowned to make way for human progress

image.altText: Footage of Cauchi running towards Amy Scott who is holding a gun

props.synopsis: In the first of five weeks of a coronial inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing,  the court heard about the confusion around a possible second offender and concerns the centre's alarms were too loud for emergency services.

title.children: What was learnt about the Bondi stabbings in first week of inquest

image.altText: Russell Brand (2)

props.synopsis: British actor and comedian Russell Brand has appeared in a London court to face charges of rape and sexual assault involving four women.

title.children: Russell Brand granted bail on rape and assault charges

image.altText: Kimi Antonelli celebrates at Miami GP.

props.synopsis: Italian rookie Kimi Antonelli becomes F1's youngest pole sitter in any format after lapping fastest in the Miami Grand Prix sprint qualifying, as he edges out Australia's Oscar Piastri.

title.children: 18yo creates history at Miami GP after pipping Piastri in sprint qualifying

image.altText: Two men in full lyrcra swim suits running along a beach, tethered to each other.

props.synopsis: Vision-impaired athlete Timothy Green will race in Sunday's Ironman Australia triathlon. He says Ironman has been "life-changing" and he wants to inspire his young, vision-impaired son.

title.children: Blind athletes show 'courage and resilience' in Ironman triathalon

image.altText: Female surfer speaking to media, smiling, prior to a surfing event

props.synopsis: Surfing legend Stephanie Gilmore has said the competitive fires are still burning as she prepares to return to the World Surf League this weekend on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Surfing legend Gilmore still driven to take on the world

image.altText: Dylan Brown speaks to Nicho Hynes after an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Nicho Hynes's professional but unspectacular leadership of the Sharks is the sort of role he's cut out for, but his early success made us think he was something else.

title.children: Hynes finds his peace as wandering NRL eyes turn elsewhere

image.altText: Martin Grant stands in a room with fashion posters on the wall, surrounded by mannequins with red shirts and dresses.

props.synopsis: From designing his first clothes as a teenager in Melbourne to the runways of Paris with celebrities, Martin Grant has had a full career — and it's not over yet.

title.children: He's dressed Cate Blanchett and Lady Gaga, and is still making fashion waves
